text: Walter Edwin Drumheller (November 9, 1878 - May 18, 1958) was an American track and field athlete who competed at the 1900 Summer Olympics in Paris, France. Drumheller competed in the 400 metres. He placed fifth in his first- round (semifinals) heat and did not advance to the final. Similarly, he placed sixth or seventh in the first round semifinals of the 800 metres and did not advance to the final. ==References== * De Wael, Herman. Herman's Full Olympians: "Athletics 1900". Accessed 18 March 2006. * Category:1878 births Category:1958 deaths Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 1900 Summer Olympics Category:Olympic track and field athletes of the United States Category:American male sprinters
title: Walter Drumheller
